page.title: 05Farming:dairy.
page.content: We interviewed Mr. Skilbeck,a local farmer,who is also on the Parish Council.He farms over 200 acres in partnership with his brother at Bridge Farm and Glebe Farm.They are tenant farmers,renting the land from Mr. Forbes-Adam.Mr. Skilbeck is also the local milkman,and now owns the only dairy herd in our area.At one time most farmers kept dairy cattle. He is afraid that soon doorstep deliveries of milk may be stopped,to conform with other EEC countries.He has 200 chickens and a herd of 30 Friesian cattle,grazing on 20 acres.His milk is taken to Holme on Spalding Moor,and is used to make butter,cream and yoghurt,under the brand name of Dale Farm.He sells 7 types of milk,as well as other dairy produce,potatoes and eggs.
